H0.text: Erosion is the action of lichens on rocks that grow on them, producing acid that reacts with part of the rock to form soil.

H1.text: Fertilizer is the action of lichens on rocks, which grow on rocks and produce an acid that reacts with part of the rock, forming soil.

H2.text: Chemical weathering is the action of lichens on rocks that grow on rocks, producing an acid that reacts with part of the rock to form soil.

H3.text: Mechanical weathering is the action of lichens on rocks, as lichens grow on rocks, produce an acid that reacts with part of the rock, and thereby form soil.

A4.text: Lichens on rocks are among the most effective biological agents of chemical weathering.

A5.text: Chelating compounds, mostly low molecular weight organic acids, are capable of removing metal ions from bare rock surfaces.
